messages.message: Is there a command to run a single python test suite locally? I am trying to run a particular handler suite in api-server (`webserver/api-server/test/unit/py/instabase/handler/api/v2/zero_shot_idp/test_inference_lite.py` ) without having to run `make test` and go through all test cases

This is what I did:
1. Add this into your `.zshrc`
```pytest () {
	test_module="instabase_unit_tests.instabase.$1"
	echo "Will run test in $test_module"
	echo "Building for testing..."
	make clean build build-test copy-unit-test
	poetry env use $(pyenv root)/versions/$(grep 'python =' pyproject.toml | cut -d '"' -f 2)/bin/python && poetry install
	echo "Running tests in $test_module"
	cd build/test/py
	poetry run python -m unittest $test_module
	cd ../../..
}```
2. Then run `pytest handler.api.v2.zero_shot_idp.test_inference_lite`
That script is super handy @Xindi Xu, it may be worth adding to the dev setup guide
Or even better, just check it in!
